resources.string: Lupine Observations
Defeat Fangsnap in Fangsnap's Den for Survivalist Wilson in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What are you referring to?"

Animals talking, walking on two legs, and at least one of them is even taking on human form.\n\nMy theory is that Angry Earth's infected them with lycanthropy - we have ourselves a legitimate werewolf!
"It changes from human to wolf?"

More like wolf to human, and frankly, becoming human's driven the wolf mad, rabid.\n\nFangsnap is the name of the beast, and it's slain several travelers out toward the coast. I don't know what to do.
"Hunt it down?"
Aye, it's the only choice we have, it seems. I tried, but the beast got the better of me.\n\nIf you're the hunting type, keep a lookout for Fangsnap, and if you find it, destroy it fast.
Defeat Fangsnap in {POITags}
Defeat Fangsnap
If my suspicions are correct and animals really are taking on human form, things are gonna change.\n\nWe humans might soon go from being predators to being prey.

You did it then? You hunted down the monstrous beast, Fangsnap? \n\nI'm guessing he didn't take on his human form, but I swear it's true. I've seen the tracks. Either way, the damn thing needed to be destroyed.
Pirates Will Pirate
Defeat Neptunite Pirates and collect Pirate Booty from chests for Constable Muller in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What do you mean?"
Rilette Wilson's claiming there's a werewolf stalking the shore, and others say the Lost have gone to war.\n\nThe soulless, aimless Lost fighting each other - it makes no sense. I don't buy it.
"Stranger things have happened."
Oh, don't you start in on me, too. Sure, the Lost Buccaneers have been raiding, but that's what they did in life - typical Lost behavior.\n\nI think once we get our stuff back this'll blow over.
"Is that something I can help with?"

Why yes. About time someone wants to get to the solution. The Buccaneers are out at the wreck of the Neptune's Fury.\n\nGive the bloated fiends a taste of their own medicine - raid them, and steal THEIR booty.
Defeat Neptunite Pirates and collect Pirate Booty at {POITags}
Defeat Neptunite Pirates
Collect {ItemName} from Chests
I mean, how long have the Lost pirates of Aeternum been raiding the supplies of the living?\n\nIt's normal Lost pirate behavior, nothing more.
Haha! You gave those damn buccaneers a little payback, didn't you? Let's see the spoils!\n\nPerfect! This should make everyone happy, get things back to normal. Thank you, {playerName}.
War of the Lost
Defeat Seele's Withered at the Decayed Campsite for Magistrate Gurkin in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"They're fighting each other?"

Indeed. The Lost Buccaneers have been fighting the Withered and vice versa.\n\nTo see the Lost with such focus and intention is disturbing, and the worst part is that Constable Muller won't even acknowledge it!
"Why not?"

The woman is in denial, I tell you. She prefers to believe that everything is normal, well, as normal as it gets.\n\nWe have no time to convince her, however. We need to maintain the balance out there.
"Why not let them destroy each other?"

Because the victor will turn on us, and we can't have that.\n\nRight now, the Withered have the upper hand. If you'll destroy as many as you can, I'll see you well-rewarded, {playerName}. You have my word.
Survey the situation at {POITags}
Destroy Seele's {targetName}
Destroy Seele's {targetName}
I tell you - I've fought them myself - I've seen the look in their eyes and the way it's changed.\n\nThe Lost are finding some sense of purpose, and we need to prevent that.
You've seen for yourself now, haven't you? They fight with increased ferocity, with more precision, with purpose.\n\nStriking a blow to the Withered was the perfect thing. Thank you.
The Greater Threat
Kill Eastshore Forces at the Eastshore Pier and Gather Fishing Supplies for Magistrate Gurkin in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"The Lost are fishing?"
Yes! You get it, right? It sounds harmless in a way, but it's further evidence that they are more and more sentient.\n\nI swear by the Ancients, this is the most terrifying thing I have heard yet.
"What should we do?"
We need to fight them while they are weak, and discourage them from advancement.\n\nEastshore Pier, that's the place. Go and strike down the soggy bastards... and confiscate their fishing supplies.
Exhaust Eastshore forces and supplies at {POITags}
Defeat Eastshore Forces
Collect {ItemName} from Chests
There was a time I used to fish from the Eastshore Pier myself.\n\nThat was back before it fell to the Lost in the first place.
Hah! No more fishing for the Lost! That should stop them from getting ideas.\n\nI just hope it's enough. Artificer Taethen and I are still trying to get Constable Muller to come around.
Disarmament (Elite)
Confiscate grenades from chests and destroy Ching Shih the Shark for Artificer Taethen in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What kind of work?"
Those blasted Lost Buccaneers are arming themselves, even developing new weapons.\n\nIt's unheard of for the Lost, and we need to disarm the soulless bastards before it catches on.
"Where are their weapons?"
They're stockpiling grenades at an old wreck known as the Minnow's Revenge.\n\nChing Shih the Shark is their ringleader - take him down and confiscate the grenades and that'll put an end to it.
Defeat and pilfer from Lost Buccaneers at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {ItemName} from Chests
Watch yourself out there. Rumor says the pirates' grenades are enhanced with azoth.\n\nNever thought I'd see the day.

Took down Ching Shih the shark, did you? And you got the grenades? Well done, {playerName}.\n\nThat'll cut a hole in their sails, I tell you. Let's hope the Lost Pirate forget all about their ambitions.
Slaying the Shadowslayer
Kill Erika the Shadowslayer in Solitude Cemetery for Artificer Taethen in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"The Withered have the edge?"

Exactly. With the Pirates pushed back, the Withered are now on the offensive.\n\nIt's their leader we need to deal with - the Shadowslayer - she's been a dark threat here for decades, and even darker now.
"Where is the Shadowslayer?"

You'll find her in Solitude Cemetery, but be careful, she's made many Lost from those who crossed her path. \n\nWhen you've done that, I'd ask you to take a shot at convincing Muller of what we're up against.
Put an end to the story of the Shadowslayer at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Destroy the Shadowslayer, {playerName}, whatever it takes.\n\nThen go and try to convince the Constable to finally acknowledge our plight.

So you went out and dealt with the Shadowslayer? It's about time someone did that.\n\nI know you've been working with Gurkin too, but come on, you aren't buying into this idea of the Lost being more advanced, are you?
"It does seem to be true."
Dammit, I was afraid you'd say that! Why can't the Corrupted just stay up at the mountain and the Lost stay lost?\n\nDon't even get me started about the Angry Earth - Wilson's about driven me insane.
Where The Boars Roam
Defeat Boars and Tuskgore at Boarsholm for Survivalist Wilson in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"Are you sure about that"
I am quite certain that the boar in question is responsible for slaying a traveler to the north. \n\nEven more concerning - I've come to believe that this lycanthropy is contagious, too.
"You think we could catch it?"
No, but I think it can spread among the wildlife. We just get the were-boar and any boars who've had contact.\n\nTuskgore is the beastly creature's name. Destroy it, and any other boars nearby.
Purge Boars at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}s
Defeat {targetName}
If we let this strange new mutation from the Angry Earth spread, our days our numbered.\n\nDestroy Tuskgore, for the safety and security of everyone on Aeternum.
The deed's done then? Tuskgore is no more? That is a big relief.\n\nThat boar was a monster and if my theory about Lycanthropy is true, the danger was even greater still.
Scouting Report
Destroy Channelview Pirates in Channelview Post and Oceanview Pirates in Oceanview Post and look for anything suspicious. Then report back to Constable Muller in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"What's Fort Damnation?"
That's the fort up on the hill. Once upon a time, that's where the region was governed from.\n\nA naval force from the Arabian Sea reigned supreme - then they all became Lost.
"And what's going on there now?"

Nothing, we hope, but maybe you should check it out. Steer clear of the Fort itself - let's not stir things up.\n\nConfront the Lost in the east and west lookout camps and see if there's anything suspicious.
Vanquish Lost Pirates at {POITags}
Defeat Channelview Pirates for {ItemName}
Vanquish Lost Pirates at {POITags}
Defeat Oceanview Pirates for {ItemName}
The more I think about this, the more I start to worry.\n\nMaybe I should've listened to Gurkin from the start.
Thank the stars you're back! What did you find? Runestones... what the heck?\n\nMaybe it's some kind of Ancient magic that's giving the bastards this renewed sense of purpose?
Damnation's Fall
Defeat Admiral Reis in the center ship of Fort Damnation. Then report back to Constable Muller in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"Maybe we should attack."

Launch a frontal attack on Fort Damnation? Are you out of your mind? \n\nWait, don't answer that. Here's the thing, it's not the fort itself that's the problem, it's the fort's commander, Admiral Reis.
"Who's Admiral Reis?"

Probably one of the most dangerous fleet commanders of all history - literally thousands killed in his name.\n\nIf you're going up there, you gotta get the Admiral to make it count. Oh, and take friends - you'll need them.
Take down Admiral Reis at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
I'll give you this much - you've already proven to have the strength to back up your bravado - but if you're going to take on Admiral Reis, you'd best be prepared.

Well, I thought I'd see the sun rise in the west before I saw anyone take down Admiral Reis.\n\nI gotta hand it to you - you are a force to be reckoned with. I think it only fitting you receive a proper reward.
Paying Respects
Travel to Mourningdale and convey Barkeep Andris's respects to Barkeep Brewell.
"What happened?"
The Watcher there, Guerra - he fell to the Lost. Quite a hero, I understand.\n\nIn fact, if you pass through Mourningdale, please offer my condolences to Barkeep Brewell. We go back a ways.
The news from Mourningdale is tragic, indeed.\n\nIt almost make me feel guilty that things are going so well here.
Come and sit down and have a drink on the house, traveler.\n\nWe all mourn the passing of a hero today - Watcher Guerra - did you know of him?
"Yes, Andris offers her condolences."
Ah, old Andris is still keeping bar out there. Good for her.\n\nKind of you both, of course, but it is our Magistrate for whom we should all feel bad. She is quite beside herself.
Archdeacon Azamela (Expedition)
Collect the head of Archdeacon Azamela in The Depths for Magistrate Gurkin.
"Is there another threat?"
You’re damn right, there is! The Corrupted! The Shattered Mountain? \n\nJust when we thought we'd earned a reprieve, now the Corrupted have a foothold, right here in Restless Shore.
"Then we'll drive them out."

Coming from you, I believe it. They're in a place called "The Depths."\n\nA Corrupted Warlord's taken charge there, but the architect is called Archdeacon Azamela. Destroy the bastard, and I'll heap rewards on you.
Who knows what darkness this Archdeacon Azamela is cooking up in the Depths.\n\nAs you said, they must be driven out of Restless Shore, and kept out.
Is that it? You destroyed the Archdeacon, didn't you? There's another blow for righteousness and the good of humanity!\n\nWell done, {playerName}, and as promised, here is your reward.
Defeat the architect of {POITags} within its halls
Defeat Archdeacon Azamela
Defeat Archdeacon Azamela and Collect His Head
Hoppy Trails
Defeat Stanley the Rabbit to summon and defeat The Harekeeper for Survivalist Wilson in the Restless Shores Settlement.
"Did you have another request?"

This request is a bit more... unconventional. There is a small island nearby I would like you to investigate. \n\nRabbit Island is a great source of meat and fur but recently the hunters of the settlement have been avoiding it, claiming it to be cursed.
"Cursed?"
I don't know how a bunch of bunnies like friendly ole Stanley could be cursed, but many now refuse to visit. \n\nGo to Rabbit Island and see what all this fuss is about, would you?
Investigate {POITags} for a haunting
Defeat Stanley
Defeat The Harekeeper

A man used to live on that island all by his lonesome, kept to himself and his rabbits well enough. Perhaps you could ask him about the rumors of a haunting of the island and see what he makes of all of this?

So the Harekeeper passed on? I'm glad you put him to rest. His furry friends will flourish with or without him, I suspect. \n\nBut I imagine they'll miss their kindly caretaker. Maybe I'll miss the Harekeep a little myself, as well.
Meat For Nekumanesh (Expedition)
Collect Hunks of Meat for Nekumanesh the alligator from Corrupted Leaders in The Depths Expedition.
"Wow, so small…"
(The alligator snaps at you, clearly offended by the insinuation that he isn't big enough.)
"Maybe I can help you get bigger."
(Nekumanesh pants like a dog and licks his sharp teeth. Who could have left him here?)
(Nekumanesh looks at you suspiciously. He had been expecting you to return with food.)
(With a hearty snap of his jaws, Nekumanesh eats up all the meat you gave him like he'd been starving. Did he just get a little bigger…?)
Venture into the Depths Expedition for Nekumanesh
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
Defeat Archdeacon Azamela and collect {itemName}
